ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Angle, in degrees, at which first target stim is presented
Angle in degrees, in absolute value, at which first response is made (if ReportOrder is 1, FirstReport is relative to FirstTarget; if ReportOrder is 2, FirstReport is relative to SecondTarget)
Angle, in degrees, separating the FirstTarget from the SecondTarget
Whether participant must respond first to first target or to second target
Angle, in degrees, at which second target stim is presented
Angle in degrees, in absolute value, at which second response is made (if ReportOrder is 1, SecondReport is relative to SecondTarget; if ReportOrder is 2, SecondReport is relative to FirstTarget)
Angle around which the FirstTarget angle is jittered

Degrees of error in FirstReport (if ReportOrder=1 this error is calculated relative to FirstTarget; if ReportOrder=2 this error is calculated relative to SecondTarget; importantly, unlike the data contained in FirstReport and SecondReport, the data herein are not reported as absolute values and therefore include a value sign, indicating clockwise or counterclockwise response errors)

Degrees of error in SecondReport (if ReportOrder=1 this error is calculated relative to SecondTarget; if ReportOrder=2 this error is calculated relative to FirstTarget; importantly, unlike the data contained in FirstReport and SecondReport, the data herein are not reported as absolute values and therefore include a value sign, indicating clockwise or counterclockwise response errors)
